intro: Arabis recta, commonly known as the upright rockcress, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes mustard and cabbage plants. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils and prefers full sun. It produces small, white or pale yellow flowers in clusters, which bloom in early spring. Arabis recta is often used in rock gardens due to its compact growth habit and ornamental value.
